review_title: Opportunity to develop on the job teaching skills and gain professional teaching qualification
pros: Staff very helpful and good to work with. Although many people are over-worked they will always try to help you. Managers supportive of student disciplinary issues. Some money available for teaching resources. Ability to gain formal qualification whilst teaching for as little as 3 hours per week. Driven and passionate Principal.
cons: Typical of FE. Many departments are over-stretched so staff do the job of 2-3 people. Managers spend a lot of time in meetings but insufficient time finding out what they can do to support front- line staff. If you are teaching a non-practical subject there is little acknowledgment of the lesson preparation and marking that you are required to do.

review_title: Despite the advent of the digital age, the administrative paperwork seems endless.
pros: Opportunities exist for promotion from within.  How long one stays there is down to their ability to conform to the senior management style.
cons: Many staff have experienced intimidation and bullying from all management levels.  As a result stress levels run high among many of the teaching staff.
